intro: Saurauia purgans, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a deciduous shrub native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, yellow berries that turn red when mature, which are rich in vitamin C. Saurauia purgans thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and partial shade. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and valuable for medicinal use.
